Participle

Verb

Accusative 		ἀχεύοντᾰ
akheúonta 	ἀχεύουσᾰν
akheúousan 	ἀχεῦον
akheûon 		ἀχεύοντε
akheúonte 	ἀχευούσᾱ
akheuoúsā 	ἀχεύοντε
akheúonte 		ἀχεύοντᾰς
akheúontas 	ἀχευούσᾱς
akheuoúsās 	ἀχεύοντᾰ
akheúonta
Vocative 		ἀχεύων
akheúōn 	ἀχεύουσᾰ
akheúousa 	ἀχεῦον
akheûon 		ἀχεύοντε
akheúonte 	ἀχευούσᾱ

akheúonte 		ἀχεύοντες

akheúonta

	ἀχευόντως

Etymology 1

From δέω (déō, “I bind”).
Participle

ἐποτρῡ́νᾱς • (epotrū́nās) m (feminine ἐποτρῡ́νᾱσᾰ, neuter ἐποτρῦνᾰν); first/third declension

κεχηνώς • (kekhēnṓs)

Nominative 		κεχηνώς

νήσων • (nḗsōn)

Declension

Case/Gender 		Masculine 	Feminine 	Neuter 		Masculine 	Feminine 	Neuter 		Masculine 	Feminine 	Neuter
Nominative 		νήσων

Participle

οἰχόμενος • (oikhómenos) m (feminine οἰχομένη, neuter οἰχόμενον); first/second declension

    present mediopassive participle of οἴχομαι (oíkhomai)

Adjective

οἰχόμενος • (oikhómenos) m (feminine οἰχομένη, neuter οἰχόμενον); first/second declension

    gone, absent
    undone, ruined
    (euphemistic) dead

Participle

προηγούμενος • (proēgoúmenos) m (feminine προηγουμένη, neuter προηγούμενον); first/second declension

    preceding, going first, leading the way
    (expression) κατά (katá) προηγούμενον λόγον (lógon): according to a guiding principle
    (in neuter plural): τά προηγούμενα
        premises, initial data
        (mathematics) forward points (at the same side of a radius vector
        (astronomy) τὰ προηγούμενα ζῴδια: the leading signs in the daily movement of the heavens

Declension

Notes:

    This table gives Attic inflectional endings. For declension in other dialects, see Appendix:Ancient Greek dialectal declension.

First and second declension of φαινόμενος; φαινομένη; φαινόμενον (Epic)

Participle

    shining

# =================== W =======================

Participle

ὤν • (ṓn)

    present participle of εἰμί (eimí)
    actual, real

Inflection
First and third declension of ὤν, οὖσα, ὄν

Case/Gender 		Masculine 	Feminine 	Neuter 		Masculine 	Feminine 	Neuter 		Masculine 	Feminine 	Neuter

Participle

ὤσᾱς • (ṓsās) m (feminine ὤσᾱσᾰ, neuter ὦσᾰν); first/third declension

    aorist active participle of ὠθέω (ōthéō)

Declension
First and third declension of ὤσᾱς; ὤσᾱσᾰ; ὦσᾰν (Attic)
